name: mr_pete
text: Resolved: That wearing a suit of paper causes manifestos in previously manifesto-free persons. Will the party arguing in the affirmative address the assembly?

name: straw
text: It ain't the suit it's the fingernail schnapps.

name: kazad
text: LLAMA OPINION BATTLE GO!

name: fineoakstructure
text: It's perfect...their even facing each other.

name: fineoakstructure
text: ("they're")

name: carlyle
text: "It's been over a year and it's never seen closure."

name: gouldgonewild
text: One year later, no continuation on the llama battle

name: fattypneumonia
text: Bleat counterbleat.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i say, let 'em chat .

name: softerworld
text: but...what does this mean ?

name: daftsquare
text: Does anyone wish as much as I do that Marx was drunk on Fingernail Schnapps wearing a newspaper suit on a Berlin sidewalk when he wrote his manifesto?

name: axhoola
text: He wasn't?

name: straw
text: Nope, it was in Brussels.

name: deimosrising
text: Okay people seriously, how is this not one of the highest rated strips. Potato power. Come on.

name: zaratustra
text: POTATO POWER IS UNTRACEABLE POWER

name: centipede_damascus
text: IT'S TOTALLY FREE AND OF THE EARTH

name: goro
text: Did the potato as power source appear first in Goats or Achewood? Anyone?

name: i_love_kate
text: It is a genuine Thing. Why does there have to be any kind of link between the two mentions?

name: soilentshuggah
text: Gave it a 5, dude. Potato power!

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fallow_fields, butts, NeoNaoNeo, Mangtastic, sex_bicycle, The_Dude, goro, Semiquaver, atticusonline, Vee, aHatOfPig, stormagnet, pquinn87, rateoforange)

name: atticusonline
text: good lord, why are you here?

name: zem
text:
oh so that's how those pamphlets are made

probably dr. bronner's too

name: jaldor
text: dr. bronner's is some grade-a crazy

name: bookofsand
text: His graphics looks like they belong in the Principia Discordia. PLANT YOUR SEEDS PEOPLE.

name: homepie
text: In parks. On lots. Public flower beds. In remote places. At City Hall. Wherever. Whenever. Or start a plantation in your closet (but read up on it first for that). For casual planting, its best to soak them in water for a day and plant in a bunch of about 5, about half an inch deep. Don't worry much about the weather, they know when the weather is wrong and will try to wait for nature. Don't soak them if its wintertime. Seeds are a very hearty life form and strongly desire to grow and flourish. But some of them need people's help to get started. Plant your seeds.

name: mangtastic
text: I was thinking just this.  Perhaps this manifesto is a parody of Discordianism?

name: boredom_man
text: I suspect that it is a parody of that which discordianism is parodying, since attempting to parody discordianism would be like trying to make out with the inside of your small intestine.

name: aelindil
text: Chubbied for the horrorscape that simile made of my mind.

name: trevor
text: http://www.stopabductions.com/

name: dueledge
text: don't they know tin foil is the only way of stopping alien abduction? Tin foil powered by potatoes for preference.

name: tekende
text: That is incredible. Thank you for much amusement!

name: cousinted
text: the cat solves humanity's problems while wearing a newspaper tuxedo.

name: nicolae
text: Ray Smuckles....He gets things done.  While wearing a newspaper tuxedo.

name: equinn2006
text: PHONE BOOTH, HEAVENLY

name: spinynorman
text: When achewood gets really bizarre I often feel it needs to be accompanied by an accordion. Tom Waits style. Yes, there, I said it.

name: ovenface
text: people sure make an exorbitant amount of references to tom waits in acheworld.

name: zem
text: say, that reminds me of this tom waits song with an accordion in it

name: spinynorman
text: He's a weird motherfucker who sings about weird people. Achewood, like its Hell or Heaven counterparts, is Kind of a Weird Place.

name: laikalost
text:
There's a guy who brings a typewriter into the coffeeshop what I normally frequent, and he taps away at it for about 2hrs at a time.

I don't know if he's partial to old technology, or if he's making a statement about the laptop generation, but I'm convinced that I hate him. And his family.

name: odei
text: That's a shame because typewriters are rad as hell.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: a chubby for the inclusion of his family.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Oh dang it how did this even happen? I wasn't even trying to post anything. That's 2 mistakes on this page. Shit, dude.

CRAP.

name: mattylite
text: Man, he nails the style of those certain kinds of crazy people like that.  I mean dead-on, what with all the capitalization and underlining and weird jumps in syntax and all that.  Sweet.  Crazy people are hilarious.

name: edgy
text: I love the way he looks with his bare ass sitting on the ground. The tie part is so cool too, what a great suit.

name: m3funkyb
text: do you know this guy? i've met A GUY, SIMILAR

name: rykan
text: WHERE DID HE GET THE TYPEWRITER FROM?

name: laserblade
text: Is... does he want to make a vaporizer?  Is that the blueprint?

name: puguglypress
text: I think this would work!

name: crawfomp
text: Oh I get it - the potato is powering a grow lamp that creates the molecule necessary for Angelic Communion.
